- [`as_GHRformulas`](GHRmodel-reference/as_GHRformulas.Rd.qmd): This function converts a character vector of suitable R-INLA formulas into a structured  GHRformulas  object.

- [`cov_add`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_add.Rd.qmd): This function appends one or more covariate names to all elements (i.

- [`cov_interact`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_interact.Rd.qmd): This function generates interaction terms between covariates specified in the  pattern  or  name  arguments.

- [`cov_multi`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_multi.Rd.qmd): This function generates all possible combinations of covariates by selecting one
 variable from each user-defined group.

- [`cov_nl`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_nl.Rd.qmd): This function transforms selected covariates identified by  pattern  or  name  into non-linear
 terms using INLA's  f()  syntax.

- [`cov_uni`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_uni.Rd.qmd): This function returns a list where each element contains a single covariate, based on
 covariates specified in the  pattern  or  name  arguments.

- [`cov_varying`](GHRmodel-reference/cov_varying.Rd.qmd): This function transforms covariates identified by  pattern  or   name  into
 varying effect terms of the form: f(unit, covariate, model = 'iid') ,
 which allows covariates to have varying slopes across spatial or temporal units.

- [`crossbasis_inla`](GHRmodel-reference/crossbasis_inla.Rd.qmd): This function is a wrapper around  dlnm::crossbasis 
 to generate cross-basis matrices that
 capture nonlinear effects of a predictor across both exposure and lag dimensions.

- [`crosspred_inla`](GHRmodel-reference/crosspred_inla.Rd.qmd): This function takes an object of class  GHRmodels , extracts the relevant
 coefficients and variance-covariance matrix, and then calls
 dlnm::crosspred  to compute predictions over a range of covariate
 values (or at specified points).

- [`dengue_MS`](GHRmodel-reference/dengue_MS.Rd.qmd): The  dengue_MS  example data set contains monthly counts of notified dengue cases by
 microregion, along with a range of spatial and spatiotemporal covariates
 (e.

- [`dengue_SP`](GHRmodel-reference/dengue_SP.Rd.qmd): The  dengue_SP  example data set reports the weekly number of notified dengue cases in
 the municipality of SÃ£o Paulo together with climatic covariates.

- [`extract_names`](GHRmodel-reference/extract_names.Rd.qmd): This function allows the user to select variables from a data set by prefix
 (using the  pattern  argument) or by exact name matching.

- [`fit_models`](GHRmodel-reference/fit_models.Rd.qmd): This function fits a set of  INLA  model formulas, provided in a  GHRformulas  object,
 to a specified dataset.

- [`get_covariates`](GHRmodel-reference/get_covariates.Rd.qmd): Extracts covariates from a  GHRmodels  object and returns them as a list of character vectors.

- [`lag_cov`](GHRmodel-reference/lag_cov.Rd.qmd): This function creates lagged versions of one or more numeric or categorical variables
 in an equally spaced time-series data set.

- [`map_MS`](GHRmodel-reference/map_MS.Rd.qmd): A simple feature ( sf ) multipolygon object representing a map of  Mato Grosso do Sul , Brazil,
 including 11 municipalities.

- [`onebasis_inla`](GHRmodel-reference/onebasis_inla.Rd.qmd): This function is a wrapper around  onebasis  to
 create a one-dimensional basis for spline modeling.

- [`plot_coef_crosspred`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_coef_crosspred.Rd.qmd): Generate plots from a  "crosspred"  object.

- [`plot_coef_lin`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_coef_lin.Rd.qmd): This function extracts fixed-effect coefficients from a specified model in  models ,
 filters them by name or interaction pattern, and produces a forest plot (point estimates
 with error bars).

- [`plot_coef_nl`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_coef_nl.Rd.qmd): Generates plots of nonlinear effects from one or more fitted models contained within a  GHRmodels  object.

- [`plot_coef_varying`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_coef_varying.Rd.qmd): Generates a forest plot for a specified spatially or temporally varying coefficient
 (i.

- [`plot_fit`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_fit.Rd.qmd): This function creates a time-series plot comparing observed cases with fitted values from one or more models
 in a  GHRmodels  object.

- [`plot_gof`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_gof.Rd.qmd): Provides visualization of model performance using selected goodness-of-fit (GoF) metrics for one or more models.

- [`plot_ppd`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_ppd.Rd.qmd): This function draws kernel-density curves for posterior-predictive samples
 and observed data using  ggplot2::geom_line() .

- [`plot_re`](GHRmodel-reference/plot_re.Rd.qmd): Generates plots of random effects from one or more fitted models contained within a  GHRmodels  object.

- [`rank_models`](GHRmodel-reference/rank_models.Rd.qmd): This function ranks fitted models in a  GHRmodels  object by a chosen metric
 (e.

- [`sample_ppd`](GHRmodel-reference/sample_ppd.Rd.qmd): This function refits a specified model from a  GHRmodels  object and generates
 samples from its posterior predictive distribution.

- [`stack_models`](GHRmodel-reference/stack_models.Rd.qmd): This function stack together two or more objects  GHRmodels  object,
 returning  one   GHRmodels  object that contains  all  the input models.

- [`subset_models`](GHRmodel-reference/subset_models.Rd.qmd): This function subsets selected models from a  GHRmodels  object into a new
 reduced  GHRmodels  object.

- [`write_inla_formulas`](GHRmodel-reference/write_inla_formulas.Rd.qmd): This function streamlines the creation of INLA-compatible model formulas
 by automatically structuring fixed effects, random effects, and interactions.
